description: Application to vary condition 2 (approved plans), 3 (materials), 5 Inclusive Design), 7 (Passive Design), 8 (Green Roof), 9 (SUDS), 10 (BREEAM), 11 (Bird and Bat boxes), 13 (Roof-top Structures), 15 (Ventilation), 16 (Energy Strategy), 17 (Communal Boiler), 19 (Refuse/Recycling), 20 (Sound Insulation) and 21 (Cycle store) of planning permission ref: P121605 dated 21/12/2012 for 'Part demolition, refurbishment and erection of a part one and part two storey roof extension and new mezzanine floor level for use as office floor space (Class B1) at 29-39 Mount Pleasant. The change of use and refurbishment of part of the buildings including 5 Rosebery Avenue to provide a retail unit (Class A1) and 7 no residential dwellings (Class C3) and part demolition and erection of a single storey roof extension off Warner street for residential floor space (Class C3) as well as photovoltaic panels solar thermal panels plant and associated works'. Proposed amendments include reduced massing of 5th floor gallery; reduced massing of Warner Street extension; 1no. additional residential unit; redesigned cladding on extensions; removal of green wall; relocated entrances; internal reconfiguration; revised energy strategy; and amendments to details required to be submitted by conditions attached to permission ref: P121605.'
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than the expiration of 21/12/2015.

REASON: To ensure the commencement timescale for the development is not extended beyond that of the original planning permission granted on [21/12/2012] [LBI ref: P121605]. Furthermore, to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5).
